business.headline: Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

US adds 1,42,000 jobs in August; unemployment rate drops to 4.2%While the job data fell short of expectations, a slight dip in the unemployment rate to 4.2% indicated that the labour market is gradually cooling off, but not dramatically.

IPO investors are not looking beyond listing gains, are they missing out?According to a Sebi study, 70% of the shares, by value, were sold within a year of the IPO. The quick turnover is particularly noticeable in cases where IPO shares see a strong rise in value right after listing.

Anant Ambani donates 20 kg gold crown worth Rs 15 crore to Lalbaugcha RajaLalbaugcha Raja, Mumbai's most popular Ganesh idol, was unveiled on Thursday ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi. Devotees visit the Lalbaugcha Raja for darshan during the 10-day Ganesh festival.

Explained: Why Godfrey Phillips shares hit record high despite market downturnAt the closing bell, the shares of Godfrey Phillips were up 12.69% at Rs 7,204.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the stock jumped 14.50% to reach a record high of Rs 7,320, defying a sharp correction in the domestic indices.

Tata Motors shares decline for 6th straight day. Is it a good time to buy?Tata Motors stock settled over 1.8% lower on Friday, extending losses for the sixth consecutive session. Read on to know whether it is the right time to buy the stock.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, Nifty slips under 24,900 on US data jittersThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1017.23 points to close at 81,183.93, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 292.95 points lower to end at 24,852.15.
Godfrey Phillips set to consider 2:1 bonus issue; shares jump over 9%A bonus issue is a way for companies to reward existing shareholders without making them pay for the additional shares.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 5 lakh croreThe bloodbath on Dalal Street has wiped off nearly Rs 5 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Government may slash petrol, diesel prices as global crude oil rates fallUS crude oil prices dropped by more than 1% on Wednesday, falling below $70 per barrel. Brent crude prices followed suit, falling by $1 to reach $72.75 per barrel.
Bina Modi to vote on behalf of family trust at Godfrey Phillips AGMThe Delhi High Court recently allowed Bina to cast her vote on behalf of the trust, which holds a 47.5% stake in the company.

Goldman Sachs gives SBI 'sell' rating with revised target price. Know whyThe brokerage highlighted a growing risk-reward imbalance for SBI's stock, driven by challenges in maintaining a strong return on assets.

India's household food spending dips to less than 50%: ReportThe change in spending, highlighted in a recent report by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), signals a shift in how Indian families allocate their monthly budgets.
Sensex, Nifty down 1%: What's behind today's stock market turbulence?Today's market turbulence is partly linked to investor jitters ahead of the US non-farm payrolls report expected later today.
Explained: Why Vodafone Idea shares tumbled over 14% today As of 11:51 am, Vodafone Idea's shares were trading at Rs13.60, down nearly 10%.
Boss Packaging Solutions makes debut on NSE SME at 25% premiumBoss Packaging Solutions listing: The stock was listed at Rs 82.5 on the NSE SME, marking a 25% premium over its IPO price of Rs 66.
Sensex down nearly 900 points, investors lose over Rs 4 lakh croreStock market turmoil: At 11:27 am, the Sensex was down 883.93 points to 81,317.23, while the Nifty50 fell 255.95 points to 24,889.15.

Rekha Jhunjhunwala-backed Baazar Style Retail lists a flat on Dalal Street Baazar Style Retail listing: Baazar Style Retail's IPO received strong interest from investors, with an overall subscription of nearly 41 times by the time it closed.
Sensex falls nearly 600 points, Nifty tumbles ahead of key US jobs dataThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 553.9 points to 81,647.26 at 9:55 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 156.30 points to 24,988.80.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Congress releases first list for Haryana polls, fields Vinesh Phogat from JulanaFormer Chief Minister and veteran Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda has been fielded from the Garhi Sampla-Kiloli seat.

Raids lead Enforcement Directorate to RG Kar ex-principal's luxurious bungalowED officials discovered a luxurious bungalow in Bengal's South 24 Parganas linked to former RG Kar Medical College and Hospital principal Dr Sandip Ghosh, as part of an ongoing probe into alleged financial irregularities at the institution.

Sunita Williams says goodbye to Starliner as it departs space station for EarthThe troubled Boeing Starliner left behind the astronauts -- Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore -- as it departed the International Space Station on Friday. The astronaut capsule to land in the New Mexico desert.

Praveen Kumar, Hokato Sema extend India's medal tally to 27 Paralympics 2024: Praveen Kumar won gold in men's high jump while Hokato Sema clinched bronze in men's shot put. India extended their medals' tally to 27 in the quadrennial event.

Gayatri Devi's days in Emergency: Marriage proposals and sewer rats in TiharThe Princess of Cooch Behar and Maharani of Jaipur, Gayatri Devi, was jailed for five-and-a-half months during the Emergency. She spent those months in Tihar jail with political prisoners, pickpockets, prostitutes, and sewer rats for company.

Omar Abdullah on Afzal Guru's hanging: No purpose served by executing himOmar Abdullah said that 2001 Parliament attack convict Afzal Guru's hanging "served no purpose", adding that he didn't believe in capital punishment.

Cop's daughter, gangster's wife is BJP pick against Bhupinder Hooda in HaryanaManju Hooda, the BJP candidate for the Garhi Sampla-Kiloi constituency, is set to contest against Congress strongman Bhupinder Singh Hooda in the upcoming Haryana Assembly elections.

Donald Trump's sentencing in hush money case delayed until after US electionTrump, the Republican nominee for president, had asked Justice Juan Merchan to push back his sentencing date until after the November 5 election. Trump had previously been scheduled to be sentenced on September 18, less than two months before the election.

Canada is approving fewer visas, turning away immigrants in record numbersCanada is turning away record numbers of immigrants, with a 20% increase in visa rejections and border refusals. In July, 5,853 foreign travellers were refused entry, and 285 visa-holders were deemed inadmissible. The government is approving fewer visas, citing public concerns over housing shortages and high prices.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

US Open semi-finals LIVE: Fritz beats Tiafoe to set up final clash with SinnerUS Open 2024 Live Updates: World No.1 Jannik Sinner made his way through to the final after beating USA's Jack Draper in straight sets. Taylor Fritz beat Frances Tiafoe 4-6, 7-5, 4-6, 6-4, 6-1 to enter his maiden Grand Slam final.

iPhone 16 and Plus model to get minor upgrades, fresh  report revealsApple will launch the iPhone 16 lineup in India on September 9. Ahead of the release, a reliable report claims that the standard models won't recieve big upgrades. Here are the details.

Are pregnancy cravings real or are they just attention-seeking behaviour?'What are you craving?' is a question people often ask pregnant women. But do these cravings really happen because of pregnancy, or could they be more related to behavioural factors?

Upload, undress, blackmail: AI 'nudify' apps emerge as new weapons of extortionImagine you are travelling on the metro. Someone secretly takes your photo and by the time you get down at your stop, he or she could have a hyperrealistic nude photo of you. Welcome to the scary world of "undressing" apps.

Jannik Sinner first Italian man to qualify for US Open singles finalUS Open 2024: Jannik Sinner put his best foot forward and beat Jack Draper 7-5, 7-6 (7-3), 6-2 in the semi-final of the men's singles on Friday at the Arthur Ashe Stadium.

Co-actors, director defend Nivin Pauly amid sexual assault allegationsDays after a woman filed a sexual assault case against Malayalam actor Nivin Pauly, his co-actors and director of the upcoming film "Varshangalkku Shesham" stated that he was filming on the dates when the alleged incident took place.

Deepika Padukone-Ranveer Singh seek blessings at Siddhivinayak TempleParents-to-be Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh visited the Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai, on Friday, September 6. Several pictures of the couple were shared online.

AAP-Congress alliance in Haryana hits roadblock over seat-sharing: SourcesAAP sources have indicated that if Congress insists on maintaining the current seat-sharing formula, an alliance will not be formed for the October 5 Assembly elections.

Bengal Governor sends anti-rape bill for President's considerationWest Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose referred the anti-rape bill passed by the state Assembly to President Droupadi Murmu for her consideration. The Governor accused the state government over "lapses" in the bill.

15 dead, many injured after bus crashes into mini-truck in UP's HathrasA roadways bus hit a mini-truck from behind on National Highway 93 in UP's Hathras, killing at least 15 people and injuring many.
India's climate swap: Flood-prone areas now face drought, and vice versaBy 2036, more than 1.47 billion Indians could be highly exposed to climate extremes.
Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.
US citizen shot dead by Israeli troops during West Bank protest: ReportThe woman was rushed to Rafidia hospital in Nablus with a gunshot to the head and was later pronounced dead.

How NSG commandos ended plane-hijack crisis in Amritsar in 5 minutesIn 1993, an Indian Airlines Delhi-Srinagar with 141 people on board was hijacked by a Hizb-ul-Mujahideen terrorist, who hid two pistols in the plaster moulds on his legs. As the plane stopped at Amritsar, NSG commandos stormed IC 427 and ended the hostage crisis in just five minutes. This was in sharp contrast to the IC 814 Kandahar hijacking of 1999.

Actor Park Seo-joon, SEVENTEEN's Vernon pose together, fans call them iconicKorean actor Park Seo-joon was recently seen attending an event with SEVENTEEN member Vernon and BIG BANG member Taeyang.

Sudhir Mishra defends Anubhav Sinha amid IC 814 row: Won't find a more patriotic...Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra has defended director Anubhav Sinha amidst criticism regarding the latter's show, IC 814: The Kandahar Hijack. Mishra argued that Sinha's intentions were not malicious, and the backlash is unwarranted.

Ganesh Chaturthi: Ankita Lokhande, Tina Dutta bring Ganapati Bappa homeAs Ganesh Chaturthi 2024 celebrations begin, several television and film celebrities, including Ankita Lokhande and Tina Dutta, have welcomed Lord Ganesha into their homes. Other celebs, such as Dhanashree Verma and Apurva Agnihotri also brought home Ganpati idols.

sports.headline: Jannik Sinner reveals his weaknesses after Draper's 'too nice' remarks at US OpenJannik Sinner opened up about his weaknesses after Jack Draper said that the Italian is 'too nice'. Sinner beat Draper in the semi-final to become the first Italian to reach the US Open final.

Who is Hokato Sema? India's bronze-medallist from Nagaland shines in ParalympicsHokato Hotozhe Sema's bronze at the Paralympics 2024 marks a historic moment for Nagaland and India. Overcoming personal tragedy, he shattered the Paralympic record and brought glory to country.

Jack Draper points out 'anxiety and humidity' for vomiting incident in semi finalJack Draper blamed humidity and his anxiety after a vomiting incident in the first semi-final of the US Open 2024 against Jannik Sinner.

Mark Wood ruled out for remainder of 2024 after right elbow injuryMark Wood has been ruled out of the remainder of 2024 due to an elbow injury. Wood would be looking to get fit before the tour of India and Champions Trophy.

Ailing Jack Draper vomits on court, goes down fighting in semi-finalUS Open: UK's Jack Draper vomited on the court and looked in some discomfort during his semi-final against World No.1 Jannik Sinner on Friday at the Arthur Ashe Stadium.

Jannik Sinner ready to embrace 'tough challenge' in first finalUS Open 2024: Jannik Sinner was happy to be playing in the final at Flushing, but also acknowledged the challenges that come with playing in the summit clash.

Hokato Sema wins shot put bronze as India seals 15th athletics medal Paris Paralympics: India's Hokato Hotozhe Sema clinched bronze in the men's shot put F57 event with the best attempt of 14.65 metres at Stade de France.

Jelena Ostapenko, Lyudmyla Kichenok clinch women's doubles title US Open 2024: Jelena Ostapenko and Lyudmyla Kichenok won the women's doubles title after beating Zhang Shaui and Kristina Mladenovic 6-4, 6-3 in the final.

US Open semi-finals LIVE: Frances Tiafoe, Taylor Fritz level on two sets eachUS Open 2024 Live Updates: World No.1 Jannik Sinner made his way through to the final after beating USA's Jack Draper in straight sets. Frances Tiafoe has got off to a brilliant start after winning the first set against Taylor Fritz in the all-American final at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

Praveen Kumar wins gold in men's high jump as India clinch 26th medalIndia's Praveen Kumar won the gold medal at the men's high jump T64 final during the 2024 Paris Paralympics on Friday. Praveen secured gold this time with a jump of 2.08 metres. This is India's sixth gold and 26th medal at the Paris Paralympics.

3rd Test: Captain Pope's hundred puts England on top on rain-hit Day 1England vs Sri Lanka: Ollie Pope scored a brilliant unbeaten hundred to lead England to 211 for 3 at stumps on a weather-affected first day of the third Test against Sri Lanka at The Oval on Friday.

2nd T20I: Josh Inglis' record hundred gives Australia series winScotland vs Australia, 2nd T20I: Josh Inglis hit a record-breaking 43-ball hundred to help Australia beat Scotland by 70 runs and clinch an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match T20I series.

Paris to honour late Olympian Rebecca Cheptegei, put her name on venueThe city of Paris plans to name a sports venue after the late Ugandan Olympian Rebecca Cheptegei to honour her legacy and tragic death. The proposal will be discussed by city officials in October.

Ajaz Patel reflects on life as New Zealand spinner: Hungry on subcontinent toursSpeaking to the press in Greater Noida ahead of the one-off Test against Afghanistan, New Zealand spinner Ajaz Patel spoke about the challenges of being a spinner in the BlackCaps team. Ajaz has played only five Tests since his historic 10-wicket haul in a Test match in Mumbai in December 2021.

Josh Inglis hits 43-ball T20I hundred, fastest by an Australia batterAustralia's Josh Inglis made history on September 6 with a 43-ball century, the fastest T20I hundred by an Australian. Inglis' explosive innings helped Australia set a formidable 196-run total against Scotland.

Bergwijn hits back after Netherlands coach criticises move to Saudi ArabiaSteven Bergwijn has openly criticized national team coach Ronald Koeman for his remarks regarding Bergwijn's recent transfer to Saudi Arabian club Al-Ittihad. The move led to Bergwijn's exclusion from the Netherlands squad, sparking a heated exchange between the player and coach.

The move led to Bergwijn's exclusion from the Netherlands squad, sparking a heated exchange between the player and coach.

Lack of game time fuels New Zealand spinners in subcontinent: Ajaz Patel Speaking to reporters ahead of the first Test between New Zealand and Afghanistan in Greater Noida, left-arm spinner Ajaz Patel spoke about the importance of staying hungry when the BlackCaps spinners get opportunities in the subcontinent. Ajaz shed light on how difficult it is to deal with the lack of game time for spinners in home conditions.

Paris Paralympics: Golden boy Praveen Kumar once fought feelings of inferiority Paralympics: Praveen Kumar was once plagued by feelings of inferiority due to a shorter leg. On Friday, the 21-year-old was brimming with confidence when he set a new Asian record and won gold in the men's high jump T-64 category.

Bellingham, Militao, Camavinga out: Real Madrid slapped with injury crisisReal Madrid's injury crisis deepens with nine players sidelined, including key stars Jude Bellingham and Eduardo Camavinga. Manager Carlo Ancelotti faces a tough challenge in fielding a competitive squad as the La Liga season progresses and Champions League beckons.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
